org.soulwing.cdi.properties.spi

Interface PropertyConverter

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BooleanPropertyConverter, BytePropertyConverter, CharacterPropertyConverter, DatePropertyConverter, DoublePropertyConverter, EnumPropertyConverter, FilePropertyConverter, FloatPropertyConverter, IntegerPropertyConverter, InternetAddressPropertyConverter, LongPropertyConverter, OptionalPropertyConverter, ScheduleExpressionPropertyConverter, ShortPropertyConverter, StringPropertyConverter, UriPropertyConverter, UrlPropertyConverter

    public interface PropertyConverter
    An object that converts the string representation of property value to an instance of a target type.

    A property converter is configured for the Pinject extension by placing a provider configuration file in the resource directory META-INF/services of a directory or JAR file on the classpath of the extension. The name of the configuration file is:

    org.soulwing.cdi.properties.spi.PropertyConverter

    The file may contain one or more fully-qualified class names of classes that implement this interface.

    Author:
    Carl Harris

      A context for a property conversion.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        String getName()
        Gets the name for this property converter.

        The Property qualifier allows a named converter to be specified.

        Returns:
        converter name (never null)

      • supports

        boolean supports(Class<?> type)
        Tests whether this converter supports a given type.
        Parameters:
        type - the subject type
        Returns:
        true if this converter can converter string representations of a property of the given type

      • convert

        Object convert(String value,
             PropertyConverter.Context context)
               throws IllegalArgumentException
        Converts the given string representation of a property value to an instance of the underlying type supported by this converter.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to convert
        context - conversion context
        Returns:
        a representation of value as type T
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given value is a syntactically invalid string representation for type
